bio:treatment.discussion: Genera ca. 8, species 100+ (4 genera, 7 species in the flora):

Plants of Dimorphotheca cuneata (Thunberg) Lessing, a native of southern Africa, have been collected outside cultivation in Arizona (Gila County, ca. 1000 m): subshrubs or shrubs to 100 cm, leaves cuneate to obovate, 1–2(–3)cm, margins dentate to denticulate, faces ± glutinous, phyllaries usually 13, 6–9 mm, ray corollas abaxially bluish to violet, adaxially white, disc cypselae obovate to nearly orbiculate, 10 mm.

references.reference: Norlindh, T. 1943. Studies in the Calenduleae 1. Monograph of the Genera Dimorphotheca, Castalis, Osteospermum, Gibbaria, and Chrysanthemoides. Lund.

key_statement.description: Annuals, perennials, or shrubs; cypselae not fleshy (often tuberculate or ridged and/or winged).
Disc florets bisexual (some or all fertile)
Cypselae arcuate to ± coiled, abaxially tuberculate, sometimes winged
Cypselae triquetrous-prismatic to clavate, ± tuberculate and/or winged
